doc.after: As of 2011[update], the health care system in Kolkata consists of 48Â government hospitals, mostly under the Department of Health & Family Welfare, Government of West Bengal, and 366Â private medical establishments;[171] these establishments provide the city with 27,687 hospital beds.[171] For every 10,000Â people in the city, there are 61.7Â hospital beds,[172] which is higher than the national average of 9Â hospital beds per 10,000.[173] Ten medical and dental colleges are located in the Kolkata metropolitan area which act as tertiary referral hospitals in the state.[174][175] Calcutta Medical College, founded in 1835, was the first institution in Asia to teach modern medicine.[176] These facilities are inadequate to meet the healthcare needs of the city.[177][178][179] More than 78% in Kolkata prefer the private medical sector over the public medical sector,[113]:109 due to the poor quality of care, the lack of a nearby facility, and excessive waiting times at government facilities.[113]:61
